roleset.name: to push quickly and forcibly, a forcful forward push
roleset.note: THRUST-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls push-12-1-1, carry-11.4-1-1. (from thrust.01-v)
THRUST-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on thrust-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls push-12-1-1, carry-11.4-1-1. (from thrust.01-n)

example.name: resultative
example.text: [*] Perhaps most exciting , the device is thrusting open a window to the workings of the brain .
example.arg: a window to the workings of the brain

example.name: all arguments
example.text: It more than doubled Federal 's long-term debt to $ 1.9 billion [*U*] , thrust the company into unknown territory -- heavy cargo -- and suddenly expanded its landing rights to 21 countries from four .

example.name: just arg1
example.text: as the play progresses the thrust of Mr. Gelbart 's satire loses its sharpness as his targets pop up ever more predictably .

example.name: all args
example.text: when shooting O'Hara's death scene, Bob Wall mistimed his thrust of the broken bottle towards Lee and severely cut Lee's hand
